channel.title: State of RSC Development
channel.description:
What's going on? I've been looking around here over the last few months and have seen nothing done. Wheres the servers that try to emulate the good old RSC? if you all seem to think RSCDaemon was already finished then your very wrong.
RSCDaemon has hundreds of little bugs/missing features that i know many of you don't know about, quite a few of you can fix these bugs probably. All i am seeing is these 'funservers' since it seems 'RSC-like or low exp rate' servers can't seem to match RSCAngel.
This thread isn't about me spreading the word of RSCA, it's some incentive to leading you to share/fix/add features/bugs to RSCDaemon and actually improve the minor things. RSCDaemon pretty much has all major aspect inside worth caring about, but really there is so many little things that can distinguish a private server between the official.
ill throw out a few quick ones i could name off the top of my head, but there really is hundreds lying around.
path validations for missiles (ranged/maging through walls etc) facing NPC's when talking to them shared exp when killing monsters crumble undead, confuse spells cannons different sounds when fighting undead/armored NPCs proper abstracted quests (none of this hardcoded stuff) player & npc path blocking better formulas, including equipment stats (weapon aim/magic/prayer) points taken into calculations shops selling/buying prices to vary depending on stock
then you've got NPC/item/object locations that need more added, many more scripted NPC's ingame to do tasks (potion maker, dye creator that sort of stuff)
All i see is high rate EXP servers/funservers that pretty much favor donators to rule the server. I've been around this community a long time and it seems everything is dead.
I'm planning on helping development and the sharing of code by adding a plugin system and a much easier NPC script system to RSCD. Allowing you all to write NPC's like you would bot scripts, the plugin system would allow me to write say, a cannons class and instead of me writing up a tutorial on where to paste which bits of code, obviously you just throw it in the plugins folder and it'd be plug and play.
That is if anyone is interested, or would use it.

item.title: State of RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Jessekinss:

I can’t be fucked to read all of that - It’s probably just a re-write of everything that was said, and you brown-nosing.

Yep… Because that’s what I have always done in the past… It’s the ignorant people like you that ruin communities.

[quote=“Jessekinss, post:61, topic:297192”]Kid hush - The only reason why it’s not bothering you is because the double standard rules and the abusing are working with you.
omg no… dont ban me!1.
Seriously.[/quote]

It’s not bothering me, and I am not affiliated with RSCA in any way… Just goes to show how fail your logic is.

[quote=“degenerate, post:62, topic:297192”]codeforfame, you’re a moron. lothy is NOT the owner of these forums. whether he was here or not, the forums would still be here.

also, jessekins speaks truth!!! moparscape fails and rsc is dead[/quote]

I never said Lothy was the owner, nor did I say the forums wouldn’t be here, L2Read.

[quote="!Mew, post:63, topic:297192"][quote author=Jessekinss link=topic=393234.msg2930123#msg2930123 date=1251220887]

You blamed one of them (xent / ko9 / Pets) for changing it, not a random “somebody”. Don’t accuse people and expect them not to reply to you. Technically speaking, you are assuming as you can’t prove that any of them actually did do it. [/quote]

What the hell are you talking about? Yeah Lothy changed it to RSCA, my point is in the rules you cannot have more than 1 advertisement, am I correct? Ok then, why are you sticking up for them?

I think your the only person that cares to be honest, you care so much you sit here defending other people(s). Stop speaking for other people all the time, your’e like an annoying 12 year old.

I think you’ve mistaken. You’re ASSUMING people don’t care, because no one has gotten involved. What did Lothy say? To stop the arguing, no one wants to get muted, so they’re not going to say anything.
I honestly couldn’t care any less what you think, your opinion DOES NOT matter what-so-ever.

Wrong. If people really cared I am sure that they would post and say whatever they want regardless if they get muted or not, just like you are doing so. Your just one of those annoying kids, hence why your the only one here that’s whinning.

Anything else you have to say = w/e

Someone should delete all the spam here.

-Mew[/quote]

Exactly.

+1 on cleaning the thread.

Read full topic

item.title: State of RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:58, topic:297192”]Jessekins, you really need to just STFU, honestly, you’re just a retard that is mad. GTFO of this thread and make your own if you want to continue this. This is about the state of development, not the state of admins abusing, or anything else you’re trying to twist to make people seem like they’re doing something wrong.

It’s not like they stickied an advertisement… They changed one that was breaking rules, and needed to be blacklisted, which stops people from even seeing the site or related. They offered an alternative, instead of just leaving it blank, not the best move, but still it’s not like it’s the end of the world. The thread is also locked, who cares if they have 2 if ones locked, it doesn’t make that big of difference, people who want to play RSCA will play it, they aren’t going to get more members from a locked topic.

So just STFU, and can a staff member just mute this kid, he’s annoying and just causing problems. And everything he says is just spam/flame and it has no substance. He’s basically just saying defamatory things trying to cause trouble and make people leave moparscape for no reason.

On topic… xEnt I think that’s an awesome way to get the community involved, like plugins would do. The only issue I can think of is people adding a huge delay or something that could be annoying to players, but it would just require you to proofread the script.[/quote]

I can’t be fucked to read all of that - It’s probably just a re-write of everything that was said, and you brown-nosing.

xEnt:

@Jessekins: rules are created by admins so regular users follow them, they can bend the rules however the fuck they like, please stop with your bullshit in this thread, your making your self look like an idiot and i wouldn’t be surprised if next time an admin comes in here that you get banned.

Kid hush - The only reason why it’s not bothering you is because the double standard rules and the abusing are working with you.
omg no… dont ban me!1.
Seriously.
[center] Clearly everyone else is wrong and you’re right… Jesus why don’t you open your eyes and see that no-one agrees with you. Several people including 2 mods and an admin have told you to stfu or fuck off. If you think this mute is without just cause then there really is no hope for you.[/center]

Read full topic

item.title: State of RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

Jessekinss:

So as long as you can get a laugh out of it, you can break your own rules, correct?

An eye for an eye.

Jessekinss:

Hiring 2 out of 3 moderators that ran a server was a good idea to you? Guess not, look what’s happening.

Like xEnt already pointed out, only KO9 was modded at that time. I was still running DarkQuest.

Jessekinss:

I can’t say I would miss theirs either, especially all of this abusing, double standard, etc. You break your own rules, defend your moderators without even checking into it, and tell me to leave. BOY you are one good administrator kid. I envy you so much.

Just… leave?

[quote=“Jessekinss, post:34, topic:297192”]Again like I said to KO9, mute me for speaking the truth. I even Emailed you about it a while ago, what did you do? Ignore it. I even went out of my way to PM you to say I Emailed you, you again ignored it.

Do you want to know why you get no respect? Because you don’t deserve any.[/quote]

So you’ve been proven wrong on almost all occasions, yet you’re “speaking the truth”? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 25, 2009, 02:37:36 am[/size][hr][quote=“Peeter Griffin, post:40, topic:297192”]Jesse don’t bother arguing with them, it’s quite obvious who they’re going to side with.

The fact of the matter is, they DEPEND off any released work. So give them that, let xEnt do what he wants, let them leech the code to try it themselves, then ask 100s of questions on getting it running.

Look at EasyRSC, look at how well that turned out. 16-17 pages long worth of questions.

@xEnt: I’m not trying to attack you honestly, it’s just that i’m trying to make a point. Development needs to stay private, even if it means that no one emulates it the way we want it to.[/quote]

You do realize that the 16-17 pages worth of questions is still more then you’ve ever distributed here? Yeah, it may have brought up a lot of questions… but it also helped a few people, which is all you can go for.

Also, moparscapes only value isn’t in sharing your work… it also includes helping people / answering questions. Obviously not all questions deserve an answer (mainly because they’re not HOW-TO questions but rather “can you do this for me?” questions), but work with what you have. Help people that deserve to be helped or just leave.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:

What did I learn from doing that?

20 coins is the best option to buy woad leaves from Wyson for. And it’s exactly like RSC, whereas before it open up a shop window to purchase it at the wrong price.

Read full topic

item.title: State of RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

@Jessekins: When we were all modded, only KO9 ran RSCA IIRC, i joined him after then Peeter did.

@Peeter Griffin: Almost all of my development over the last few months is private and shared between the RSCAngel team, i’m just trying to give it a little kickstart.

Not long ago at RSCAngel i made a thread about our NPC scripting system, which people (even people that didn’t know much) could help make npc scripts very easily.

Here 2 examples

Customs officer

[code]/**
* ID 163 - Customs Officer
*
* @author xEnt
*/

option = PickOption("Can i board this ship?", "Does Karamja have any unusual customs then?");
if(option == 2) {
	NpcTalk("I'm not that sort of customs officer");
}
if(option == 1) {
	NpcTalk("You need to be searched before you can board");
	option = PickOption("Why?", "Search away I have nothing to hide", "You're not putting your hands on my things");
	if(option == 3) {
		NpcTalk("You're not getting on this ship then");
	}
	if(option == 1) {
		NpcTalk("Because asgarnia has banned the import of intoxicating spirits");
	}
	if(option == 2) {
		if(HasItem(318, 1)) { // Karamja rum
			NpcTalk("Aha trying to smuggle rum are we?");
			RemoveAllItem(318);
			SendMessage("The customs officer confiscates your rum");
		} else {
			NpcTalk("Well you've got some odd stuff, but it's all legal");
			NpcTalk("Now you need to pay a boarding charge of 30 gold");
			option = PickOption("Ok", "Oh, I'll not bother then");
			if(option == 1) {
				if(HasItem(10, 30)) {
					RemoveItem(10, 30);
					SendMessage("You pay 30 gold");
					Wait(1500);
					SendMessage("You board the ship");
					Wait(3000);
					Teleport(269, 648);
					Wait(1000);
					SendMessage("You arrive at Port Sarim");
				} else {
					PlayerTalk("Oh dear it seems i don't have enough money");
				}
			}
		}
	}
}[/code]

As you can see it’s very easy to use, even people with no clue could copy/paste bits of scripts, mix them together to get something properly working. To save time compiling and testing these scripts, you can modify the script at runtime, and test without compiling.

I have a class set up with a bunch of these easy methods ‘SendMessage, Wait, Teleport etc’ anything that would need to be used, will be in there as well as further direct player class support if needed.

Wyson the Gardener:

/** * ID 116 - Wyson the Gardener * * @author Ecko @RSCAngel */ NpcTalk("I am the gardener round here"); Wait(500); NpcTalk("Do you have any gardening that needs doing?"); option = PickOption("I'm looking for woad leaves", "Not right now thanks"); if(option == 1) { NpcTalk("Well luckily for you i may have some around here"); PlayerTalk("Can i buy one please?"); NpcTalk("How much are you willing to pay?"); option = PickOption("How about 5 coins?", "How about 10 coins?", "How about 15 coins?", "How about 20 coins?"); if(option == 2) { NpcTalk("No no that's far too little. Woad leaves are hard to get you know"); NpcTalk("I used to have plenty but someone kept stealing them off me"); } if(option == 1) { NpcTalk("No no that's far too little. Woad leaves are hard to get you know"); NpcTalk("I used to have plenty but someone kept stealing them off me"); } if(option == 3) { NpcTalk("Mmmm ok that sounds fair."); if(HasItem(10, 15)) { // 15 coins SendMessage("You give wyson 15 coins"); Wait(1000); RemoveItem(10, 15); SendMessage("Wyson the gardener gives you some woad leaves"); AddItem(281, 1); // 1 woad leaf } else { PlayerTalk("I don't have enough coins to buy the leaves. I'll come back later"); //Lol they fucked up on the grammar here too } } if(option == 4) { NpcTalk("Ok that's more than fair."); if(HasItem(10, 20)) { // 20 coins SendMessage("You give wyson 20 coins"); RemoveItem(10, 20); SendMessage("Wyson the gardener gives you some woad leaves"); AddItem(281, 1); // 1 woad leaf NpcTalk("Here have some more you're a generous person"); AddItem(281, 1); // 1 woad leaf } else { PlayerTalk("I don't have enough coins to buy the leaves. I'll come back later"); //Lol they fucked up on the grammar here too } } }

This one is written by Ecko.

These are both using the original RSC text exactly, i have about 10 NPC scripts done however i won’t share them all, since they really are not that hard to do, i know you guys would have a ton of fun sharing/writing these, and id have some fun leeching some P2P NPC scripts off you guys if they were good.

@Old School Player: i saw your thread about getting a NPC handler team to write NPCs, was exactly what i was going to suggest, a little ‘script dump/sharing community’ but using these sorts of scripts.

Read full topic

item.title: State of RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @Peeter_Griffin Peeter Griffin
item.description:
@Peeter_Griffin wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:41, topic:297192”]@Jessekins

I dont want to read threw all the bullshit but u said something like what a coincidence 2 of 3 mods from rsca or something.
So I dont get it? Can they not run a server?

@Peter Griffin
I believe public development is overall greater then private development, if we didnt have a bunch of whatever u call them who cant contribute. We need more public development, when you see that someone has a skill/quest/whatever you might want it and of course you want it better then yours so you advance it farther (competition) Thus overall more advancement and development in rsc . The leak of rscdv25 made this community shit.[/quote]

Most communities support public development of any sort becomes it welcomes everyone who is capable of learning and using their brain. In this case, moparscape does not fall in that category, look at the RS2 section. Anyways, lets get back on topic people already voiced their opinions, as Lothy stated, we are more than welcome to leave the forums, as we surely won’t be missed.

Read full topic

item.title: State of RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @Peeter_Griffin Peeter Griffin
item.description:
@Peeter_Griffin wrote:

Jesse don’t bother arguing with them, it’s quite obvious who they’re going to side with.

The fact of the matter is, they DEPEND off any released work. So give them that, let xEnt do what he wants, let them leech the code to try it themselves, then ask 100s of questions on getting it running.

Look at EasyRSC, look at how well that turned out. 16-17 pages long worth of questions.

@xEnt: I’m not trying to attack you honestly, it’s just that i’m trying to make a point. Development needs to stay private, even if it means that no one emulates it the way we want it to.

Read full topic
